author: K Oanh Ha, Naomi Ng, Eleanor Harrison-Dengate
description: What's driving the youth-led protests sweeping across Asia? On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, why Gen Z is rising up and what its future holds.
title: From Nepal to Indonesia, What’s Driving Asia’s Gen Z Protests?

author: Matthew Bristow
description: US President Donald Trump has “decertified” Colombia as a partner in its effort to combat the drug trade, relegating the longtime US ally to the same category as Venezuela, Bolivia, Afghanistan and Myanmar.
title: Why Trump ‘Decertified’ Colombia Over Cocaine Trade

author: Mark Bergen, Ian King, Dina Bass
description: Microsoft Corp., OpenAI and other American companies announced plans to spend tens of billions of dollars on technology infrastructure in the UK, part of a series of business deals that coincide with President Donald Trump’s visit to the nation this week.
title: Microsoft, OpenAI Herald Trump’s UK Visit With AI Pledges

author: Alicia Diaz
description: US House Republicans on Tuesday passed legislation allowing District of Columbia minors as young as 14 to be tried as adults for some violent offenses, as the GOP sharpens it focus on crime following the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: House Republicans Target DC Minors in Passed Crime Bill

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s congress will discuss whether to let people make a new round of withdrawals from private pension funds.
title: Peru Congress to Discuss a New Pension Withdrawal After Boluarte U-Turn

author: Matthew Boesler
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy editor Matthew Boesler looks at the legal case hanging over the Federal Reserve. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Big Decision Hanging Over the Fed Isn’t About Interest Rates

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Former Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro on Tuesday was rushed to a hospital in the capital Brasilia after feeling unwell, according to one of his sons.
title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Hospitalized After Feeling Unwell, Son Says

author: Liam Knox, Georgia Hall
description: Universities across the US are facing funding threats from Republican lawmakers over their responses to staff and faculty members’ comments about the slain conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Charlie Kirk’s Killing Stirs Up New Funding Threats for Colleges

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada’s government will release its federal budget on Nov. 4, Finance Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne told Parliament on Tuesday in Ottawa.
title: Carney to Unveil Budget Nov. 4 With ‘Substantial’ Deficit

author: Michelle Kaske, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump set up a special mediation board to prevent a strike on the nation’s largest commuter rail, the Long Island Rail Road.
title: Trump Intervenes to Avert Long Island Commuter Rail Strike

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump said he spoke to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a move that offers to ease tensions between the two major economies amid a fight over tariffs and New Delhi’s purchases of Russian oil.
title: Trump, Modi Speak in Bid to Ease Clash Over Tariffs, Russian Oil

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A frantic four-day court fight over the fate of West African men deported to Ghana came to a head Monday night, with a US judge slamming the Trump administration’s conduct but concluding there was nothing she could do.
title: Trump’s Fast Deportations to Ghana Spotlight Court Frustrations

author: Shruti Singh
description: Chicago is stepping in to lend cash to its underfunded pensions so they have enough money to avoid asset sales to cover retirement checks as they wait for property taxes to come in after a computer issue delayed collections.
title: Chicago Advances Pension Cash to Avoid Asset Sale From Tax Delay

author: Erik Wasson
description: House Republicans unveiled a stopgap spending bill to keep the US government open past an Oct. 1 shutdown deadline, daring Democrats to vote against the measure, which does not contain health-care policies they have demanded.
title: GOP Unveils Bill to Avert Shutdown, Daring Democrats to Oppose

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s judgment in appointing Peter Mandelson as the UK ambassador to Washington was called into question by lawmakers from all major parties in an hours-long parliamentary grilling.
title: UK Lawmakers Question Starmer Decisions Over Mandelson

author: Nicolle Yapur, Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Argentina’s dollar bonds and currency are recovering from a week-long rout after President Javier Milei struck a more conciliatory tone during the introduction of next year’s budget, raising hopes he can gain support ahead of midterm elections next month.
title: Argentine Assets Rebound After Milei Strikes More Moderate Tone

author: Eva Brendel
description: Leaders in Berlin clashed over whether Germany should slow down the pace of its renewables expansion in order to focus efforts on building new gas-fired power plants, setting the stage for friction in what the coalition has dubbed an “autumn of reforms.”
title: German Leaders Clash Over Clean Energy Goals as Gas Gains Focus

author: Shruti Singh
description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson’s budget working group has given him dozens of options — including furloughs, hiring freezes, fee increases and a property tax hike tied to inflation — to choose from as he works to close a $1.15 billion deficit for next year.
title: Chicago Budget Leaders Float Cuts and Fee Hikes to Fix Deficit

author: Erik Larson
description: The US Supreme Court on Sept. 8 allowed federal immigration agents in Los Angeles to resume for now using tactics that critics say amount to racial profiling. The ruling put on hold a lower court’s temporary order that barred Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents from questioning and detaining people based solely on their ethnicity, language, occupation or presence at a particular location.
title: Why the Supreme Court Lifted a Ban on Migrant Profiling by ICE

author: Liam Knox
description: The US academic year is underway and campuses are filling up. But as students return to labs and lecture halls, they might notice more empty seats than usual — especially at schools and in programs that enroll large numbers of international scholars.
title: What Trump’s Foreign Student Crackdown Means for US Universities

author: Godfrey Marawanyika, Ray Ndlovu
description: A US lawmaker has tabled legislation that seeks to block Zimbabwe from securing new funding from the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank until it pays the $3.5 billion it owes to White farmers whose land was confiscated more than two decades ago.
title: US Lawmaker Presses Zimbabwe to Pay $3.5 Billion Debt to Farmers

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: The Netherlands will boost its defense budget next year to €27 billion ($32 billion), as the country works toward meeting NATO’s new goal of spending 5% of gross domestic product on security by 2035.
title: Dutch Boost Defense Spending to €27 Billion After NATO Pledge

author: Fernando Travaglini
description: Lower house Speaker Hugo Motta spent the weekend in talks with government members and Supreme Court justices amid his search on an agreement with lawmakers from the centrão coalition to avoid putting a proposed amnesty to vote. That measure would be applied to people who were jailed following January 2023 attacks on government buildings in Brasilia and to former President Jair Bolsonaro, who was sentenced last week to over 27 years in prison, says O Globo columnist Malu Gaspar, who cites unident
title: Brazil’s House Speaker Meets Officials to Discuss Amnesty Proposal

author: Maeve Sheehey, Erik Wasson
description: House Republican lawmakers are considering adding roughly $32 million to a stopgap spending bill to augment security for members of Congress following the killing last week of conservative political activist Charlie Kirk.
title: House GOP Plans $32 Million Security Boost After Kirk Shooting

author: Myles Miller, Chris Strohm
description: FBI Director Kash Patel pushed back against criticism from Democratic lawmakers over his handling of the manhunt for the gunman who killed conservative activist Charlie Kirk, telling senators he had no plans to step aside despite questions about his use of social media during the investigation.
title: FBI Director Assails Critics Over Failures, Says ‘Bring It On’

author: Michelle Jamrisko
description: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will have plenty to discuss this week in their first conversation since June, with TikTok, Boeing planes, rare earth magnets and Taiwan among top items for negotiation.
title: What’s on the Table When Trump Speaks With Xi Later This Week

author: Josh Wingrove, Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump signaled he was open to some concessions to the UK on trade to help ease implementation of their tariff deal ahead of a trip to the country.
title: Trump Signals He’s Open to Trade Concessions as He Heads to UK

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump said the US military had “knocked off” a third drug boat from Venezuela, despite the Pentagon so far only detailing two such strikes.
title: Trump Says US Military Hit Third Drug Boat From Venezuela

author: Zoltan Simon
description: US President Donald Trump’s administration has removed restrictions on the access of Hungarians to its US visa-waiver program, in another rollback of penalties instituted against Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government.
title: US Ends Restriction on Hungarians’ Access to Visa Waiver Program

author: Sara Forden
description: The White House says it will appeal a court decision blocking President Donald Trump’s attempt to oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook — ratcheting up a legal fight with major implications for the US central bank.
title: White House Says It’ll Appeal Court Ruling on Ousting Fed’s Cook

author: Catherine Lucey
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended the unusual arrangement allowing Stephen Miran to take a leave of absence from his White House job while serving as a US Federal Reserve governor.
title: Bessent Defends Miran’s Leave From White House to Serve on Fed

author: Sotiris Nikas
description: Greece’s new innovation and infrastructure fund wants to join with private partners to carry out €1 billion ($1.2 billion) in fresh investments in the next three to four years, said the top official overseeing the state’s assets.
title: Greece’s New Fund Eyes €1 Billion Investment in Tech, Renewables

author: John Bowker
description: A United Nations-commissioned report concluded Israel is committing genocide against Palestinians in Gaza, and called for the international community to fulfill its legal obligations to end it and “punish those responsible.”
title: Israel Committing Genocide in Gaza, UN-Commissioned Report Says

author: William Horobin, Tara Patel
description: French political parties with the leverage to prevent another government collapse are clamoring for a return of the kind of tax-the-rich policies that President Emmanuel Macron had sought to consign to the history books.
title: France’s Penchant for Soaking the Rich Returns in Budget Crisis

author: Kate Sullivan
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said US negotiators expressed disappointment to their Chinese counterparts when they learned during trade talks of China’s ruling that Nvidia Corp. had violated anti-monopoly laws with a high-profile 2020 deal.
title: Bessent Says US Expressed Dismay to Chinese Over Nvidia Ruling

author: Andra Timu
description: Romanian prosecutors unveiled what they called an elaborate Russian scheme that propelled a fringe pro-Kremlin candidate to electoral victory last year with cyberattacks and disinformation, plunging the Black Sea nation into political chaos.
title: Russian Attack on Romania’s Election Reached 1.3 Million Voters

author: Kasia Klimasinska
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent declined to comment on a report about his disagreements with another member of the Trump administration, instead jokingly pointing to a famous duel involving a predecessor and what he cast as a long history of fights at his agency.
title: Bessent Jokes About Hamilton-Burr Duel When Asked About Pulte

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain’s government and central bank raised their economic-growth forecasts for 2025, cementing the country’s status as the region’s top major performer after a bumper second quarter.
title: Spain Economy to Grow More Strongly in 2025, New Forecasts Show

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Once a sleepy fishing outpost, Chancay is now home to a sprawling container shipping facility that’s brought with it a surge in violent shakedowns and murder.
title: Extortion Gangs Are Circling Peru’s Ambitious $1.3 Billion Megaport

author: Aisha Counts, Felix Gillette
description: Ms. Rachel has enchanted millions of kids with lo-fi, educational videos. Now she’s in her “advocacy era.”
title: Why the Queen of Toddler TV Became an Activist for Gaza

author: David Herbling
description: Billions of dollars have been plundered via rampant corruption in South Sudan, according to the United Nations, financing conflict and starving essential services in one of Africa’s poorest nations.
title: ‘Plundering’ of South Sudan’s Oil Billions Fuels Crisis, UN Says

author: Saim Saeed, Jorge Valero
description: New proposals to reduce tax burdens on European savers and investors will be presented later this month by the European Commission in the latest effort to boost Europe’s savings and investment culture and mobilize private savings.
title: European Commission to Propose Tax Relief to Spur Investment

author: Jarrell Dillard, Amara Omeokwe, Catarina Saraiva
description: Efforts to shrink the federal workforce are supercharging a broader slowdown.
title: Black Unemployment Is Surging in Trump's Overhaul of US Economy

author: Wes Kosova
description: Apple, Intel, Nvidia and other companies have reversed the president’s opposition by giving him a hefty prize, along with bragging rights.
title: The CEO Guide to Getting What You Want Out of Trump

author: Beril Akman
description: A court case against the main opposition party was postponed — but only until next month.
title: Relief for Turkish Democracy May Only be Fleeting

author: Sanne Wass, Christian Wienberg
description: Denmark will invest about 1.6 billion kroner ($250 million) in Greenland’s infrastructure as the government in Copenhagen tries to fend off Donald Trump’s push to take over the Arctic island.
title: Denmark to Spend $250 Million on Greenland’s Infrastructure

author: Ditas B Lopez
description: A Philippine court has ordered to freeze 135 bank accounts linked to allegedly graft-ridden flood control projects as President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. vowed to fight corruption in infrastructure projects.
title: Philippines to Freeze 135 Bank Accounts in Graft Crackdown

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine attacked the Saratov crude-oil refinery in Russia’s Volga region overnight as Western nations seek to push President Vladimir Putin to the negotiating table.
title: Ukraine Claims Overnight Strike on Russia’s Saratov Oil Refinery

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivia’s centrist presidential hopeful Rodrigo Paz plans to inject $4 billion into the economy during his first year in office, according to his senior economic adviser, part of a bid to boost growth and promote healthier public finances.
title: Top Economy Adviser to Bolivia’s Paz Eyes $4 Billion Rescue Plan

author: Jorge Valero
description: Former European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said the European Union is moving too slowly in efforts to boost economic competitiveness, with the region “failing to match the speed” of a swiftly changing global order.
title: Draghi Laments Pace of Economic Change as EU Lags Global Rivals

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul is close to forming the country’s new government after a period of political turmoil that saw a minority coalition sideline the influential Shinawatra dynasty.
title: New Thai PM Anutin Finalizes Cabinet Lineup to Form Government

author: Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesian lawmakers are deliberating whether they should broaden the central bank’s mandate further and expand grounds for the dismissal of its officials.
title: Indonesia Weighs New Central Bank Mandate, Easier Board Removal

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The UK is willing to start talks on a visiting forces agreement with the Philippines, Manila’s defense chief said, as the Southeast Asian nation broadens global ties amid continuing tensions with Beijing over the South China Sea.
title: UK Is Keen on Visiting Troops Pact With Philippines, Manila Says

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland neutralized a drone flying over government buildings on Monday evening and detained two Belarusian citizens over the incident, said Prime Minister Donald Tusk.
title: Poland ‘Neutralizes’ Drone Over Warsaw Government Buildings

author: Andrea Palasciano, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union will delay formally tabling its latest package of sanctions against Russia, according to a European diplomat, after US President Donald Trump demanded stronger European measures as a condition for the US to move forward with its own penalties.
title: EU Delays Russia Sanctions Proposal to Align With G-7 Priorities

author: Danielle Bochove
description: The US and Canada want more icebreakers to counter Russia and China in the Arctic, as the polar region — and competition for it — heats up.
title: Nations Aiming for Arctic Power Can’t Get Enough of These Ships

author: Eric Martin, Dan Williams
description: Israel intensified strikes on Gaza City overnight as US President Donald Trump’s top diplomat warned Hamas there was a “very short window” for a negotiated deal to end the war.
title: Israel Intensifies Gaza City Strikes as Rubio Heads to Qatar

author: Frank Jomo
description: Malawian President Lazarus Chakwera faces an uphill battle to secure another term in Tuesday’s elections, with his popularity dented by spiraling living costs and fuel shortages in one of the world’s least-developed nations.
title: Cost-of-Living Crisis Blights Malawi President’s Reelection Bid

author: Alex Wickham
description: Talk of replacing Prime Minister Keir Starmer as leader of the Labour Party has spilled into the open, but the lack of a plausible replacement may keep the rebels at bay for now.
title: Lack of Successor Keeps Starmer Safe as Labour Mulls His Ouster

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: The US and India are stepping up talks to resolve their trade tensions, with two separate teams of officials meeting in New Delhi this week.
title: US Trade, Defense Teams in New Delhi to Revive Trade Talks

author: Sakura Murakami, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Agriculture Minister Shinjiro Koizumi says he will run in the ruling party leadership race as the Liberal Democratic Party looks for a successor capable of turning around its prospects and leading the nation.
title: Japan’s Rice Minister Koizumi Says Will Bid for Party Leadership

author: Philip Heijmans
description: China’s coast guard said it took “control measures” against several Philippine government vessels operating near a disputed shoal Tuesday as tensions with Manila continue to build over its long-running disputes in the South China Sea.
title: Chinese Coast Guard Targets Philippine Ships Near Disputed Shoal

author: Matthew Bristow
description: US has “decertified” Colombia as a partner in the war on drugs amid the biggest cocaine boom in history.
title: Trump Faults Petro as Colombia Named to Rogue Nation Drugs List

author: Shawna Kwan, Sangmi Cha
description: Hong Kong’s leader John Lee is expected to announce that the city is speeding up the development of a cross-border tech hub with China as the Asian financial hub searches for new growth drivers to revive its fragile economy.
title: Hong Kong Set to Detail Tech Hub Plans to Bolster AI Ambition

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan will likely leave its benchmark interest rate untouched this week after Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s recent resignation announcement added to the list of uncertainties to consider.
title: BOJ to Stand Pat as Ishiba’s Exit Adds to Clouds Over Rate Path

author: Erik Larson, Zoe Tillman
description: A US appeals court blocked President Donald Trump from removing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook from her post while her lawsuit challenging the dismissal proceeds.
title: Trump Can’t Fire Cook Before Fed Meeting, Appeals Court Says

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The US will begin formally implementing a lower 15% tariff rate on imports of automobiles and auto parts from Japan as of Tuesday morning, according to the Trump administration, in line with a trade deal between the two economies.
title: US Tariff of 15% on Japanese Auto Exports to Take Effect Tuesday
